Key Match Events: A crucial 62-run stand between George Dockrell (30*) and Mark Adair (34*) for the seventh wicket.
Jeremy Gordon held his nerve in the final over to secure the 12-run win for Canada.
Pre-Game Insights: Ireland captain Paul Stirling decided to bowl first, as he was satisfied with the pitch conditions.
The match was crucial for Ireland's progression in the tournament.
Post-Match Reflections: Ireland's performance was praised despite the loss, with focus on the batting struggles and the key partnership late in the innings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York.
Ireland needs to win their next two matches to advance to the knockout stages.
